pros: Great co-workers, leadership is available and supportive. Lots of support to manage high caseloads.
cons: Very busy, high caseload so can get stressful.

pros: Prospect has very supportive leaders and they hire people with great attitudes who really care about the work.
cons: There are some hard times with the nature of the clientele and challenges

pros: Some coworkers are amazing. Flex schedule to allow one day off every 6 weeks. Treat favorites well. Good place to get basic exp, then take that exp somewhere else wear you will be treated better.
cons: Terrible pay, minimal benefits, frequent changes to expectations, terrible treatment of employees who are disliked but competent, excessive use of firing new employees instead of addressing poor hiring practices.

review_title: decent Employer with an amazing mission
pros: great culture good executive leadership many levels of internal training lots of opportunity for professional development good ben. pkg 3 weeks of vacation 10 paid sick days opportunity to earn extra days off
cons: Heavy workload and burnout some favouritism among staff young management team so limited room for advancement pay is below industry norms

pros: - Great days off/ personal time - Supported in growth -Supportive Team
cons: - Need higher pay to meet living costs

pros: They offer really good services and programs.
cons: Very top-heavy organization. Not much transparency and are aware of issues but hide or ignore recurring problems

review_title: Hands Down the Best Employer I have worked for
pros: Prospect truly embodies its pillars and lives out what they say. I have worked in Non-Profits throughout my 10 years in Human Services, Prospect is an amazing Employer. I feel honored, and respected/valued by Prospect and the colleagues I work with. Prospect practices their pillars daily with their staff and clients and I am proud I was chosen to be apart of such a commending and life giving organization (in so many ways for clients and staff.
cons: I wish I had started working with them years ao, but I also believe I am at the right place at the right time.

pros: Serving people in the community
cons: From my experience, there is Poor management. Men are paid more and not diverse

pros:
My experience with Prospect has been amazing. They recognized your hard work, provide the tools and resources to succeed, and make sure you are comfortable asking for help if needed. 
- Meaningful job with the opportunity to work with wonderful people who actually care about the community. 
- Management really seems to care about their employees and tries different ways to keep the morale and motivation up!
- Amazing inclusion and diversity initiatives.
-They emphasize different processes to report any type of harassment if you ever experience it, which makes you feel safe and cared for.
- Great benefits.
cons: It can get busy. Not a downside if you enjoy a fast-paced environment

job_title: Employment Placement Specialist in Edmonton, AB
pros: Company Culture, Management, Work Life Balance
cons: Can't think of anything I would change

pros: Amazing cowokers, great leadership, rewarding work, decent pay, regular check ins, good benefits and RRSP program, 3 wks vacation 2 weeks sick days and earned days off. very flexible, inclusive culture.
cons: High stress, very busy, a lot of burn out.

pros:
flexible work place 
great benefits
cons:
transient staff (employees and management)
stressful workplace culture

review_title: High turnover due to poor leadership
pros: Doing work that helps people with barriers to employment. Opportunities to work in various programs. Front line workers are good people with drive to make a difference in the community. Flex time
cons: Lack of consistency, direction and support from executive and management leadership teams. Hierarchical system. You definitely know your "place" in the organization and they do not foster a culture of openness, inclusivity and transparency. They don't walk the talk. This creates the staff to feel they are not able to collaborate with their Managers and feel their are valued and supported. There is no autonomy and encouragement of self efficacy. What they say goes and if you don't like it, and speak up about it you get reprimanded or let go.

pros:
Great Culture
Amazing Leadership
Better than average Benefits
Close Knit team
cons: Not For Profit wage scales

review_title: Great organization to work and grow!
job_title: Outdoor Pursuits Team Lead in Calgary, AB
pros:
Prospect has been the best employer I have ever had, by far.  The culture that has been created over the past couple of years is amazing, and I absolutely love the team of people I work with.  Staff members work to support each other and have fun together.
Prospect recognizes the value of work/life balance and provides 3 weeks vacation, earned days off and personal days in an effort to support staff in finding a work/life balance.  
Prospect values enthusiasm and drive, and often gets behind staff members who bring forward ideas to improve Prospect as a whole or individual programs within Prospect; providing support both monetarily and through man-power to help staff see their ideas come to fruition. 
Working for Prospect, and the clients we support, you really see that you are helping to make a difference in people's lives.  Seeing a client's face when they're told they got the job is so incredibly rewarding.
cons: Opportunities that the organization can partake in, and/or offer to staff, can be limited due to funding/funder expectations.

pros: Prospect is an innovative organization that is constantly evolving with new programs. This means there are always opportunities for you to try on new responsibilities and explore new areas. And since Prospect is a relatively flat organization, it means that all levels of staff are involved in innovation and shaping our programs and internal operations. Never boring.
cons: The nature of non-profit funding means a great deal of time and effort is spent securing contracts. This can pull attention and resources from core operations. This is more of a complaint about government funding than it is about Prospect.

job_title: Employment Retention Specialist in Calgary, AB
pros: Prospect has been one of the best companies I have worked for. They value healthy work-life balance,  and ensuring a positive work culture. They support individual goals by providing educational opportunities within the community as well as at Prospect. There are endless opportunities to expand personnel knowledge and develop as an employee. This is a fantastic company to work for, and I am grateful to have the opportunity to work here.
cons: I personally do not have any cons of working at Prospect

job_title: Employment Placement Specialist in Edmonton, AB
pros: Wouldn't know !!!!! Didn't give me a chance to enter even the twenty words needed on this sub heading
cons:
Arrived on my first day at the Edmonton office to be told my services were now not required and I wasn't a fit for the company. I had moved hell and high water to work with them and then...... poof........ gone with less than ten minutes of starting
Work......... shocking and disgusting treatment of someone who was so enthusiastic to join them

pros:
Pros
Friendly staff, great benefits, rewarding experience with clients and immediate supervisor; personal days; 3 weeks vacation, artwork, and extra activities outside of work. Team building activities.
cons: Poor support of staff who work hard. Lack of appreciation. Poor work environment. Lack of policy enforcement. Micromanagement.

review_title: Great place to work and make a difference in the lives of people
pros:
Great culture and collegiality among staff.  Assisting people find work is very rewarding.  Lots of interesting programs assisting a wide variety of people seeking work so lots of opportunity to learn and grow.
Great HR support, benefits and compensation are solid.
cons: Some population groups can be tough to work with, not everyone is suited to work with all groups.

review_title: When you love where you work you can achieve great things, Prospect is a testament to this.
pros:
Company culture is a big thing at prospect and it shows. No matter what role you play in this organization you are treated with respect and are valued. 

Another huge bonus is that the management team here truly seems to care about each and every member of their team and has a heavy focus on employee personal growth and skill development to help them achieve their own personal career goals.
cons: The pay is not as good as some non- profit organizations

pros:
-Rewarding work with clients
-Good Benefits 
-Ok salary
-3 weeks vacation
cons: The last review is a complete joke.  The negativity and mismanagement exists now more than ever which is creating an extremely TOXIC AND NON-SUPPORTIVE work environment.  Do not have an opinion, or try to share your thoughts or YOU'RE FIRED, unless of course you are a favorite and doing as you are told without question.  Oh and don't look for any advancement opportunities unless you're willing to not have a say in anything and do as you are told.

review_title: Positive place, great people, strong leadership
pros: I have been with Prospect for almost 3 years, and although it started out somewhat tumultuous, BIG improvements have been  made, Change in leadership, has had an  enormous impact on workplace culture and motivation.  Staff is friendly and supportive of clients, and team mates, the team genuinely cares about the people we support. good benefits, vacation time and opportunities to grow. yearly recognition and appreciation events
cons: Pay could be slightly better, Downtown location parking is expensive.

review_title: Thinking beyond to instigate empowerment in peoples live
job_title: Outdoor Pursuits Coordinator in Calgary, AB
pros:
- Getting to think outside of the box in order to educate PDD clients on employment skills
- Getting to see clients progress in achieving employment goals
- Everyone is very enthusiastic and personable
- Opportunity to work collaboratively with other businesses and organizations moving our borders beyond the office
- Opportunity to be active and outside and share that with others.
cons: It can be mentally taxing   (but still completely worth it)

pros: If you want to work with a bunch of people who are passionate about helping and serving others, this place is it. There level of service provided to the clients there is amazing, and they do a great job of hiring really interesting and fun people, so you will have really neat people to spend your day with.
cons: As with any place, there are a few bad apples, and the pay isn't amazing.

pros: An excellent work environment with great work culture. Management is very supportive and accommodating to individual employee needs. Prospect recognizes that the work can be difficult sometimes, but there are great accommodations and earned days off that give you time to reset. It can be very challenging, but a very rewarding job!
cons: - Salary is a little low for a lot of positions

review_title: It's a wonderful organization to work for.
pros: Prospect values and encourages employees to prioritize a work life balance. Management is very supportive and staff is friendly and kind. It's a great place to work because I don't feel like I'm going to work as I enjoy everyday I am there.
cons: The location is in an unusual spot, but that's nothing that can be controlled.

pros: Prospect is a great place to work.  The nature of the work attracts great individuals who are caring and love to help people.
cons: With so many offices throughout Alberta, it can be hard to bring everyone together, they do their best during the staff appreciation events though.

review_title: Great Interview and Amazing On Boarding and Orientation
pros: Still new to Prospect but appreciate the amazing working environment. Caring, understanding and professional atmosphere that encourages team collaboration and innovation. They listen to ideas and encourage you to bring more.
cons: No cons to date, experience has been a very positive one!

review_title: Love the work and the culture, great opportunities!
pros: Collaborative teams that make things happen. Ability to learn new things, be innovative, find and solve challenges.
cons: Always busy, but for me that is a good thing!

job_title: Administrative Assistant Present in Calgary, AB
pros: Prospect has a wonderful mission and management works hard to engage staff. Great company culture!
cons: High staff turnover, but the company is working hard to mitigate this problem.

pros: People have big hearts and do their best to help others in the process of finding and maintaining work.
cons: People are people, sometimes they can do the wrong thing

review_title: Best place to work in Calgary
job_title: Administrative Team Lead in Calgary, AB
pros: Integral organisation with an inclusive, fair and fun environment.
cons: There are absolutely no cons I can think of associated with Prospect.

pros: Great co workers, passionate about the people we work with, good hr
cons: Communication, low pay,  demanding jobs

pros:
